data.title: Richard Mangum Obituary - Meridian, Idaho
data.meta_description: Richard B. “Rich” Mangum of Nampa, Idaho, passed away Sunday, December 8, 2013. Memorial services will be held Monday, December 16th, 2013, at Summers Funeral Home, Ustick Chapel (3629 E. Ustick Rd.) at 10:00 am. Directly following will be a graveside service at Dry Creek Cemetery in Eagle, Idaho.  Richard was born January 24, 1963, in Burley, Idaho, to H. Kay and Richard C. Mangum. Richard lived the majority of his life in Eagle, Idaho. He attended Meridian High School (Class of 1981). He then joined the military and was a heavy equipment operator. In 1982, he married Julie Caward, and they had four children: Lisa, born March 1983; Loni, July 1987; Jerry, January 1989; and Jeff, May 1990. One of the joys of Richard's life was becoming a Grandpa to his three granddaughters, Riley, Regan and Averi.  His favorite name to call them was 'Little Booger Pickers.'  Richard will miss the upcoming birth of his first grandson, Jaxson, in January.  In February 2008, Richard married his soul mate, Tracie deBoer.  Richard and Tracie both shared a love of NASCAR racing, and Richard’s favorite driver was Kevin Harvick.  Richard was a walking, talking encyclopedia of NASCAR; if you had any questions, he was the man to ask. They also shared a love of the outdoors.  Every weekend, Rich and Tracie would take off to their cabin in Centerville, Idaho. Sitting around the campfire with his family and friends in Centerville, Richard enjoyed life to the fullest, going on long 4-wheeler rides, snowmobiling and getting firewood.  Richard was at home when he was in Centerville; it was his get-away from the hustle and bustle of town.  He will be greatly missed by his family and all who knew and loved him.  Richard is survived by his wife, Tracie deBoer, of Nampa, ID; his mother and step-father, H. Kay Mangum and David Orm of Eagle, ID; his sisters and their husbands, Pamela (Scott) Lottman  of Boise, ID; Vicki (Chris) Rodgers of Kuna, ID; and Peggy (Steven) Wallace  of Kuna, ID.  He is also survived by his children, Jerry (Ashlee) Mangum of Kuna, ID; Lisa Mangum (Mitch) of Kuna, ID; Loni Mangum; and Jeffrey Mangum of Boise, ID; two nieces and a nephew; and recently a great grandniece.  He was preceded in death by his brother, Jerry; his father, Richard; and his stepfather, LaVond; his maternal and paternal grandparents; and several aunts and uncles.

For Immediate Need

Call us at (208) 343-6493

We are here to help you. If you have need of our services, please call us, day or night. Or, if you prefer, you can fill out the form on the right.

Pre-Arrange Your Funeral

Are you thinking about pre-planning your funeral? Pre-planning is the best way to choose how you're remembered, to ease the emotional and financial burden on your loved ones, to protect yourself from rising funeral costs, and to let your family know your final wishes.

Click here to learn more, or fill out this form and we will contact you.

Site Search

If you are looking for information on a particular topic, or if you are looking for a loved one who has been entrusted to our care, you can use the form below to narrow down your search.

Site Search

Order Flowers

Ordering flowers from our site ensures that your order will reach us or the family in a timely manner, and your gesture of support will remain acknowledged in the Book of Memories™ for future generations. We only work with local florists so we can maintain the sense of urgency and quality of your selections. We thank you for helping to support the family during their time of need, and will fondly remember your kind gesture.

Click Here

Order Tribute Gifts

We respect the sensitivity and dignity that comes with ordering tribute gifts from the funeral home. It is for this reason that we have attempted to design our online Sympathy Store with the utmost respect to the family and the deceased. We hope you find this service helpful during your time of need and would welcome any comments or suggestions you might have to help us serve our communities better.
